    Lab8

    Natalie Palmer

    4/4/2022

    Lab8.Rmd
    1. Consider a 2x2 design. Assume the DV is measured from a normal distribution with mean 0, and standard deviation 1. Assume that the main effect of A causes a total shift of .5 standard deviations of the mean between the levels. Assume that level 1 of B is a control, where you expect to measure the standard effect of A. Assume that level 2 of B is an experimental factor intended to reduce the effect of A by .25 standard deviations. A. create a ggplot2 figure that depicts the expected results from this design B. How many subjects are needed to detect the main effect of A with power = .8? C. How many subjects are needed to detect the interaction effect with power = .8?
    #load libraries
library(tibble)
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)

# define 2-factor score model
mean <- 0
sd <- 1
A <- c(0,5,10,15,20,25,50)
B <- c(0,5,-15)
AB <- rep(0,length(A)*length(B))
    # N per group
N <- 800

A_pvalue <- c()
B_pvalue <- c()
AB_pvalue <- c()
for(i in 1:1000){
  IVA <- rep(rep(c("1","2"), each=800),N)
  IVB <- rep(rep(c("1","2"), 2),N)
  DV <- c(replicate(N,c(rnorm(1,0,1), # means A1B1
                        rnorm(1,0,1), # means A1B2
                        rnorm(1,.5,1), # means A2B1
                        rnorm(1,.5,1)  # means A2B2
          )))
  sim_df <- data.frame(IVA,IVB,DV)
  
  aov_results <- summary(aov(DV~IVA*IVB, sim_df))
  A_pvalue[i]<-aov_results[[1]]$`Pr(>F)`[1]
  B_pvalue[i]<-aov_results[[1]]$`Pr(>F)`[2]
  AB_pvalue[i]<-aov_results[[1]]$`Pr(>F)`[3]
}

length(A_pvalue[A_pvalue<0.05])/1000
    ## [1] 0.908
    length(B_pvalue[B_pvalue<0.05])/1000
    ## [1] 0.926
    length(AB_pvalue[AB_pvalue<0.05])/1000
    ## [1] 0.933
